intro: Jacquemontia prominens, commonly known as the showy goldenweed, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Convolvulaceae, which includes morning glories and other vine-like plants. The plant is characterized by its bright yellow flowers with five petals and a hairy, ascending stem. Its leaves are heart-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Jacquemontia prominens typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun.
